com.epoch.chem

Class ChemUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.chem.ChemUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChemConstants, FormatConstants, LewisConstants

    public final class ChemUtils
extends Object
implements ChemConstants, LewisConstants
    Holds utility chemistry functions involving manipulations of molecules (e.g., getting enantiomers, adding explicit H atoms), electron-counting methods.

    • Field Summary

      Get the number of valence electrons of an atom, which is (1) column for columns 1 to 10, (2) column − 10 for columns 11 to 18, and (3) for lanthanides & actinides, 3 + f electrons, except the last column = 3.
      static int getValenceElectrons(MolAtom atom)
      Get the number of valence electrons of an atom, which is (1) column for columns 1 to 10, (2) column − 10 for columns 11 to 18, and (3) for lanthanides & actinides, 3 + f electrons, except the last column = 3.

      • getSGroupMolecule

        public static Molecule getSGroupMolecule(String abbrev)
                                  throws MolFormatException
        Given a SMILES definition or a shortcut group name, return a Molecule representation, with the molecule's ATTACH_PT property set to a 1-based atom number. First try using the R groups Hashtable, which also gives the attachment point; if that fails, just convert from SMILES, treating the first atom as the attachment point. Special case: abbrev="H" means "[H]"; SMILES is unfortunately obscure here. NOTE: Assumes that the shortcut group has a single attachment point.
        Parameters:
        abbrev - name of the shortcut group, such as Ph
        Returns:
        molecule representing the shortcut group, with the ATTACH_PT property set to a 1-based atom number
        Throws:
        MolFormatException - if the shortcut group can't be imported into a Molecule

      • getAttachmentPoint

        public static MolAtom getAttachmentPoint(Molecule mol)
        Get the attachment point atom as defined by the attachPt property set in getSGroupMolecule().
        Parameters:
        mol - a molecule representing a shortcut group or fragment
        Returns:
        the atom that is the attachment point of this shortcut group or fragment; null if not found, atom 1 if no ATTACH_PT property is set

      • arrangeAsBonded

        public static boolean arrangeAsBonded(Molecule mol,
                                      int[] atomIndices)
        Arranges three or four atom indices so that they correspond to a sequence of bonds in the compound. Modifies the original atomIndices parameter!
        Parameters:
        mol - the molecule
        atomIndices - 0-based indices of three or four atoms to arrange in the order in which they are bonded. The method puts the ordered atom indices back into this array.
        Returns:
        true if the atoms are bonded in sequence

      • getNumBonded

        private static int getNumBonded(MolAtom[] atoms,
                                MolAtom refAtom)
        Utility method for arrangeAsBonded(). Gets the number of atoms in an array that are bonded to a reference atom.
        Parameters:
        atoms - an array of atoms
        refAtom - the reference atom
        Returns:
        the number of atoms in atoms that are bonded to refAtom

      • getValenceElectrons

        public static int getValenceElectrons(MolAtom atom)
        Get the number of valence electrons of an atom, which is (1) column for columns 1 to 10, (2) column − 10 for columns 11 to 18, and (3) for lanthanides & actinides, 3 + f electrons, except the last column = 3. Noble gases are treated as having 8 valence electrons.
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        Returns:
        the number of valence electrons

      • getValenceElectrons

        public static int getValenceElectrons(int atno)
        Get the number of valence electrons of an atom, which is (1) column for columns 1 to 10, (2) column − 10 for columns 11 to 18, and (3) for lanthanides & actinides, 3 + f electrons, except the last column = 3. Noble gases are treated as having 8 valence electrons.
        Parameters:
        atno - atomic number of an atom
        Returns:
        the number of valence electrons

      • getMaxOuterElectrons

        public static int getMaxOuterElectrons(MolAtom atom)
        Get the maximum number of electrons that can fill an atom's outer shell (2, 8, 12, 18, or 32).
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        Returns:
        the number of electrons required to fill the outer shell

      • getSumBondOrders

        public static int getSumBondOrders(MolAtom atom)
        Gets the sum of the bond orders of an atom in a molecule, using bond orders of 1 for coordinate bonds and 0 for query bonds, and returning 0 if the atom is a multicenter attachment point.
        Parameters:
        atom - an atom
        Returns:
        the sum of the bond orders of this atom, as an int
